name: GOES-16-L2-CMI
title: GOES-16 Cloud & Moisture Imagery
description: The GOES-16 Advanced Baseline Imager (ABI) L2 Cloud and Moisture Imagery provides 16 spectral bands with high temporal resolution over the American continent. The GOES-16 satellite is significant for Brazil and South America due to its location at longitude -75°, which enables it to provide comprehensive coverage of the continent and the oceanic regions of the Pacific and Atlantic. The ABI captures 2 visible, 4 near-infrared, and 10 infrared channels at resolutions between 500m and 2km. This collection includes images acquired by GOES-16 satellite (i.e. GOES-East) in full-disk mode (i.e. a circular image depicting nearly full coverage of the Western Hemisphere). Note that the other modes, such as CONUS and MESOSCALE, are not present in this collection. The Cloud and Moisture Imagery product contains one or more images with pixel values identifying "brightness values". Cloud and Moisture Imagery product (CMIP) files are generated for each of the 16 ABI reflective and emissive bands. The collection captures CMIP product files into individual STAC Items for each observation from GOES-16 satellite. It contains the original and full-resolution CMIP NetCDF files generated by INPE's GOES-R receive station. In addition, the collection contains CMIP files in geographic regular grid format, for each of the 16 spectral bands. These versions were generated by INPE using the process of mapping data from the original geostationary projection to a geographic regular grid (EPSG:4326). The geographic area used in the remapping process covers and highlights South and Central America. The geographical limits used are the following: lower left (lon: -116.0; lat: -56.0) and upper right (lon: -25.0, lat: 35.0). The image reprojection operation is done using gdalwarp utility (https://gdal.org/programs/gdalwarp.html) with nearest neighbour resampling strategy defined. More information: Beginner’s Guide to GOES-R Series Data (https://www.goesr.gov/downloads/resources/documents/Beginners_Guide_to_GOES-R_Series_Data.pdf) and GOES-R Series Product Definition and Users Guide: Volume 5 (Level 2A+ Products) (https://www.goes-r.gov/products/docs/PUG-L2+-vol5.pdf).
